Vårt uppdrag är att se till att de som bor hos oss trivs och är trygga i det viktigaste de har; sina hem. Våra nybyggda hus möter moderna behov och de byggs på ett sätt som tar hänsyn till framtida generationer.
   

  

 För oss är hållbarhet också det rent mänskliga. Vi är högt rankade när det kommer till ledarskap och vi strävar alltid efter att du som jobbar hos oss ska få ihop din vardag: oavsett om det handlar om arbetstidens förläggning eller massage på arbetstid. Det är den omtanken som också avspeglas i vår värdegrund – i varje möte med våra kunder och hur vi är mot varandra. Har detta betydelse för dig vet vi att du kommer trivas. Välkommen till ett viktigt jobb.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en engagerad Lås- och passagesamordnare som kan ta ett helhetsansvar för skalskyddet i vårt omfattande fastighetsbestånd. Du kommer att vara en central spelare för vår förvaltningsorganisation och spela en nyckelroll i att säkerställa tryggheten och tillgängligheten för våra hyresgäster.
   

  

 I rollen som lås- och passagesamordnare kommer du att ta ett helhetsansvar för skalskyddet i Familjebostäders befintliga bestånd, som omfattar cirka 1000 byggnader över 400 fastigheter. Du blir en kompetensmässig förankringspunkt för förvaltningsorganisationen och ett viktigt beslutsstöd. Rapportering sker till närmaste chef och säkerhetschef.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du trivs i en föränderlig miljö och gillar att ta eget ansvar. Du vill bidra till förändring och utveckling inom fastighetsbranschen. Möjligheten att utvecklas och växa inom bolaget är stor. Vill du veta mer om vad vi erbjuder för förmåner och hur några av våra medarbetare upplever att det är att jobba hos oss? Läs mer här
   

  

**Vi Erbjuder**
*Ett viktigt jobb*
 Vårt allmännyttiga samhällsuppdrag handlar om något av det finaste som finns, människors hem. Tillsammans utvecklar och förvaltar vi levande stadsdelar. Det är inte bara ett jobb. Det är ett uppdrag.
   

  

*Hållbarhet i fokus*
 Vi gör hållbara val när vi renoverar och bygger nytt för att minimera vår klimatpåverkan. Samtidigt är det lika viktigt för oss att jobba med trygghet i våra bostadsområden, för att livet mellan husen ska fungera.
   

  

*Ett starkt ledarskap*
 Våra ledare får höga betyg av våra medarbetare. De har förmågan att motivera, inspirera och visa uppskattning. Hos oss kommer du helt enkelt trivas och utvecklas.
   

  

*Balans mellan arbete och fritid*
 Massage på arbetstid, ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag och ett höjt semesterdagstillägg är bara några i raden av våra förmåner som gör det enkelt för dig som medarbetare att må bra.
   

  

*En levande företagskultur*
 Vår värdegrund ger oss ett starkt stöd i vardagen – i möten med våra kunder och hur vi är mot varandra. Hos oss får du engagerade, kundfokuserade kollegor med affärsmässighet och nytänkande i fokus.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter**
* Planera och samordna lås- och passagearbetet med fokus på att utveckla och upprätthålla hög säkerhetsstandard.
* Ansvara för drift- och underhållsrelaterade frågor gällande lås och passage, inklusive hantering av behörigheter och tidzoner i passagesystem.
* Följ upp och samverka med låsentreprenörer för att säkerställa att alla säkerhetsåtgärder är uppdaterade och effektiva.
* Utveckla och förvalta styrande dokument för lås- och passage i samarbete med säkerhetschef.
* Säkerställ att alla relevanta dokument är uppdaterade och tillgängliga för rätt personer.
* Fungera som expert inom lås- och passageteknik och arrangera utbildningar för att dela med dig av din kunskap.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Relevant högskole-/universitetsutbildning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Minst tre (3) års erfarenhet av en liknande roll med koppling till fastighetsförvaltning eller närliggande till fastighetsbranschen.
* Kvalificerad praktisk erfarenhet av lås- och passagesystem.
* God kännedom om lagar och bestämmelser inom området.
* Erfarenhet av entreprenad juridik ABT och AMA eller liknande standarder.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet om LOU eller andra upphandlingsprocesser.
* Erfarenhet av projektering, projektledning, installationssamordning, kvalitetsuppföljning och fastighetsbesiktningar inom området.
* Mycket god IT- och administrationsvana och erfarenhet av digitala arbetssätt.
* Utmärkt förmåga att uttrycka sig i tal och skrift i svenska och engelska.
* Innehar giltigt B körkort.


**Personliga Egenskaper**
* Initiativtagande och förmåga att prioritera är viktigt i rollen.
* Samarbetar väl över avdelningsgränser och med externa partners.
* Tar ett stort ansvar för arbetsuppgifter och säkerställer korrekt utförande i tid.
* Kommunicerar tydligt och effektivt både muntligt och skriftligt på svenska och engelska.


**Ansökan**
 Om du känner att du passar för rollen och vill vara med och utveckla säkerhetsarbetet hos Familjebostäder, skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och ser fram emot att höra från dig. Kontakt HR-partner Fanny Johansson på 08-737 20 95 eller Dennis Bremberg, gruppchef underhåll och skador, på 08-737 23 33 om du har frågor eller vill veta mer om tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekryteringen. Samtliga av våra inköp sker i enlighet med LOU och för att kunna arbeta med oss så ska man ha varit med i upphandlingen och tecknat ett ramavtal.

title: Senior Project Leader driving Business Change - Group Financial Crime Prevention
description:
**Job ID: 24588** 






  
 





**Senior Project Leader driving Business Change - Group Financial Crime Prevention** 






  
 





 Do you want to work on strategically important topics contributing to the fight against financial crime? We are looking for a Senior Project Leader to drive complex business change projects, and develop an E2E project portfolio management capability, within the Know Your Customer (KYC) area of financial crime prevention.
 







  
 







 At Nordea, we’re committed to being a partner that our customers and society can rely on. Joining us means you’ll have a direct impact on how Nordea drives it strategy. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.
 





  
 





**About this opportunity** 






  
 





 Welcome to KYC Portfolio Management, a team within the KYC unit of Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP). We add value by leading business change projects across the KYC value chain in Nordea, and by delivering best practice in the oversight and administration of the KYC business change portfolio.
 





  
 





 As a Senior Project Leader, you will lead a wide range of high-profile change initiatives spanning multiple areas of the KYC organization, as well as play a vital role in developing the KYC portfolio management capability. It is therefore important that you have the skills to deliver impactful results through your personal leadership and subject matter expertise, while collaborating across multiple functions, agendas and management levels.
 





  
 





 This is an opportunity for you to be part of an important area for Nordea and society in general where you will be working with highly competent people in an energetic and dynamic environment. You will be collaborating with stakeholders from all over Nordea located in the Nordics, the UK, Poland and Estonia. 
 



 This role can be based in Sweden, Finland, Poland or Estonia.
 





  
 





**What you will be doing:** 





* Taking overall project ownership ensuring project plans are executed from initiation to closing
* Be responsible for project scope refinement to ensure benefit realisation takes place
* Overseeing project deliveries following the appropriate project model and framework
* Identifying and conducting analyses across the organisation and bringing expertise in strategic thinking, business case analysis and business insight
* Shaping and delivering regulatory and efficiency initiatives across the Nordic countries
* Interacting with senior business stakeholders to ensure effective and timely deliveries aligned with business expectations
* Contributing to the development, continuous improvement and administration of an E2E KYC project portfolio, encompassing intake, analysis, prioritization, management, reporting and benefit tracking



  
 





**Who you are** 






  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best and that we imagine you share with us.
 





  
 





**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Are an experienced professional within the financial crime prevention area
* Have a track record of managing complex projects focusing on business processes
* Are solution oriented, quality focused and structured
* Are adept at managing stakeholders, including senior business leaders
* Have very strong writing and presentation skills
* Are fluent in spoken and written English



  
 





**Your experience and background:** 





* 5+ years’ experience as a senior project manager in financial crime prevention or equivalent risk taxonomy
* Experience in developing, maintaining and running a project portfolio management capability
* Relevant qualifications in relation to Financial Crime Prevention (e.g. ACAMS or ICA certification) and/or project management (e.g. PRINCE2, Agile) will be considered an advantage



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 31/07/2024
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact James Rose (james.rose@nordea.com). Interviews will be conducted on a continuous basis.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
  For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Senior IT Analyst for Model Development Programme working with Credit Risk
description:
**Job ID: 22507**
 Would you like to work in an agile, friendly and international environment in close collaboration with our business teams and at the same time grow your IT analyst talent? If yes, then this opportunity is for you. We are now looking for a Senior IT Analyst, who will support our team in the Model Development Programme working with Credit Risk.
 





  

  



 At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. 
   

  





**About this opportunity**




 Welcome to the Model Development Programme in Group Functions Technology. We add value by translating business needs to operational software requirements and verify their validity and priority. We actively contribute to the collaboration between business and IT and drive requirement engineering work by making an effort in understanding both parts.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Working with technical requirement specifications in close collaboration with business analysts, IT architects and developers
* Collaborating with multiple stakeholders in alignment with the target picture to enable sustainable and reliable solutions
* Securing requirements traceability during the end-to-end development
* In cooperation with our end users ensuring that the application is continuously configured to match the changing business needs, and to ensure smooth upstream and downstream processes
* Ensuring that applications are updated according to internal guidelines and other infrastructure changes
* Facilitating understanding and impact of requirements, functional as well as non-functional, from business to technology and vice versa



  

  



 You’ll join a team where people are the most important and work is not only a place to go! We take pride in what we do, prioritize a learning culture and strive to have fun in our daily work. The role is based in Gdańsk or Warsaw with hybrid approach.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Are a self-driven team player
* Have excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, and enjoy interactions with other people
* Have good analytical and problem-solving skills
* Have a good business or technical background with great analytical skills
* Have good requirement elicitation skills (functional and non-functional requirements)
* Should be able to understand the business terminologies and act as a very good interface between Business and IT development team
* Have a foundational understanding of programming, so you are able to read it
* Are familiar with agile ways of working and methods (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban)
* Are able to find or create order in complex and chaotic processes
* Are structured and with your analytical mindset be able to handle complexity, be creative and curious
* Should be able to support in UT, ST and end-to-end UAT testing
* Added advantage in creating functional test cases and validating the results



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* 5 years experience in IT /Data Analysis
* Knowledge of Credit Risk and more specifically Risk Models
* Excellent written and spoken English communication skills
* Well versed and comfortable working with large datasets
* Profound experience in doing data analysis using SQL
* Added advantage to have Functional background around Credit Risk
* Knowing SAS/Python is an added advantage



  
 





 It is not a must that you can put a check mark to everything in the above lists, but you should be willing to proactively learn the rest.
 





  

  



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 20/07/2024
 



 .
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

title: Senior/Expert Data Governance Expert to Group Data Management
description:
**Job ID: 24435** 






  
 





 We are looking for a Senior/Expert Data Governance Expert for full-time employment agreement to continuously drive and support in securing high quality metadata capabilities, meeting the data governance needs of our stakeholders across the Group. 
 





  
 





**About our team** 






  
 





 Meet the Data Governance & Metadata Management (team name) team. Our role is to exercise a broad range of responsibilities including definition and maintenance of Group level policies and operating models, coordination, training and advisory, and metadata management to enable Nordea to take responsibility for, and gain value from data. 
 





  
 





 Our team is located in Group Business Support, Group Data Management and consists of experts in various fields of data governance where we all have a role as organizational change ambassadors, supporting the alignment and implementation of the DG Framework i.e. people, processes and technology coming to place in a good way. We are currently a team of approximately dozen experts and are looking to grow a bit. We have one or several employees in all the four Nordic countries and Poland
 





  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 





  
 





**What you’ll be doing** 






  
 





**Main responsibilities in this role:** 





* Identify, design, develop and implement efficient and effective metadata management processes and operational instructions that support to continuously maintain high meta data quality
* Engage in and develop training and knowledge sharing for practitioners using metadata services enabling them becoming a subject matter expert
* Hands-on support to the metadata owners and users by managing metadata in the services
* Develop and implement relevant monitoring and controlling processes to pursue implementation according to internal policies and relevant regulations
* As a member of DG&MM team you will also have opportunities to contribute and collaborate broadly across our area of responsibility



  
 





 The role is based in Helsinki, Gdynia, Gdansk or Stockholm.
 





  
 





**Who you are** 






  
 





**This is the right role for you if:** 





* You are passionate about business meaning of data, understand metadata and its role in enabling world class financial services.
* You are a driver with positive energy, persistent with your goals, good in building effective networks and have shown your ability to act as interpreter between business and IT. You express opinions, and key points of an argument clearly to convey your message to different audiences.
* You are proactively proposing new ideas, approaches and insights and you continuously seek opportunities for organisational improvement.
* You are able to work independently while you’re a true team-player
* It would be perfect if you’ve worked with metadata in some context, particularly in financial industry, but we’re above all observing your eagerness to learn more and solid ability to communicate with a service-minded attitude
* You develop job knowledge and expertise through continuous professional development and have keen interest and ability on sharing knowledge with others



  
 





**Your background and skills include:** 





* Previous work experience in data governance and data quality, controlling/reporting and/or projects as e.g. senior analyst
* Experience in process documentation or process development and training others
* You have professional level fluency, both written and spoken, in English language. Proficiency in Nordic languages is a definite advantage
* While we prefer a university degree in technology or business, the full combination of you is that will matter the most





**It would be ideal if you also:** 





* Have experience with IBM InfoSphere Suite: Information Governance Catalog, Information Analyzer and/or Orion Governance: EIIG
* Well familiarized into using MS-Office tools



  
 





 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
 





  
 





**A culture that fosters performance and growth** 
 in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
 





  
 





**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility. 
 





  
 





**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
 





  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 16/08/2024
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Hannu Pertti Tapani Pitkänen.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





 If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.
 





  
 





**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.** 






  
 





**We build relationships** 
 . We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
 

  
 





**We learn and develop** 
 . We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges. 
 

  
 





**We lead change** 
 . We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

title: Associate Product Marketing Manager
description:
**Juni who?** 
 👋
 



*We’re Juni. Born on the West Coast (of Sweden). Built for flexible working. And busy building a future where digital commerce is free from financial barriers. Want to be a part of it all?* 




  





**What We Do 🤔** 




 Juni gives online businesses the tools they need to save time, scale up and succeed. Our platform helps financial leaders take control of their cash flow, make better decisions and unlock the full potential of digital commerce. We even offer working capital to help them achieve their goals and dream up new ones. And that’s just for starters.
 



  





**How & why we do it** 
 🚀
 



 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
 



  





**Your role** 
 🙋
 



 As an Associate Product Marketing Manager at Juni, you will be a key facilitator of product and customer insights. Your role is crucial in ensuring that our product positioning, value propositions, competitor insights, market trends, product launches, and sales enablement are always strategically aligned and impactful. You will work closely with the Product, Commercial and Communications teams, requiring a blend of creative, strategic, and tactical skills.
 



 For a deeper understanding of Product Marketing, consider reading more here.
 



  





**Your responsibilities** 
 💪
 



  





**In This Role You’ll** 




 Be working with a wide range of stakeholders within Product, Commercial and Communications. As the marketing constituent you will own end-to-end launches of new products and key features, defining a tailored messaging strategy and bringing it to the team at Juni and to our customers.
 



  





**Within 1 Month You'll** 



* Successfully onboard and start getting to grips with Juni’s product suite, positioning and messaging.
* Build a relationship between product managers and marketing team stakeholders.



  





**Within 3 Months You'll** 



* Develop competitive positioning and feature-level comparison for established and emerging competitors in the market.
* Work with the marketing and brand teams to create assets and deliver integrated product marketing campaigns across owned, earned, and paid channels.
* Draw insights from our community of customers and apply that to Product Marketing practice.
* Have led your first product launch.



  





**Within 6 Months You'll** 



* Delivered best in class product marketing for product releases and demonstrated the successful impact they have had.
* Delivered your first internal training to internal stakeholders.
* Driven optimisation and automation in marketing together with Marketing- and RevOps teams.



  





**Your Qualifications 👨‍🎓** 




  





**What we need to see:** 



* Minimum 1-2 years experience within a B2B role (sales, marketing, product)
* Good stakeholder management and prioritization
* Previous experience working cross functionally between teams
* An inclination to data-lead decisions



  





**What We’d Love To See** 



* Previous experience with owning the end-to-end product launch and retrospective process harnessing learnings and improving efficiencies
* Ability to navigate through market product positioning and messaging nuances



  





**Your people** 
 👥
 



 We practice people-first culture. We’re real. We never wait. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
 



  





**Your benefits** 
 😍
 



 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
 


* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Unlimited in policy. Awesome.
* Global health insurance. You know. Just in case. Therapy & massage included.
* Get sick? No stress. Feel better with unlimited paid sick leave.



  





**The process 📅** 




 CV screening > Get to know us call > Team interview(s) > Values interview > Offer (for some roles we’ll include a task, but we’ll notify you if this is the case)

title: Senior/Quantitative Risk Analyst, EAD Models
description:
**Job ID: 25263** 






  
 





 We are looking for a Senior or Quantitative Risk Analyst to join EAD Models team at Nordea.  
 





  
 





 We are looking for credit risk model developers. The job provides an exciting mix of challenges, where different areas of knowledge and skills can be applied: developing advanced statistical models, designing internal software libraries, working with big data, analysing economic behaviour, understanding and abiding to regulatory constraints and further, to explain complex models to stakeholders on all levels across the bank. 
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we’re committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you’ll have an impact on how we do banking – today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.
 





  

  



**About this opportunity** 


  
 





 Welcome to the EAD Models team, part of the Risk Models Methodology & IRB Models unit. Working with us, you will be a part of one of the most important programs for the bank, which consists in upscaling Nordea’s internal models for credit risk. There are opportunities to work on all aspects of IRB model development, scorecards, PD, LGD and CCF. 
 

  
 





 As the Quantitative Risk Analyst you will have great possibilities to develop your skills within advanced modelling – a field which is in high focus in Nordea.  Being a part of the broader Group Risk organization, you'll help ensure that compliance underpins every decision we make and every action we take. By bringing your perspectives to the team and through your focus on quality and cooperation, you will be important.
 





  
 





**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Develop and maintain IRB models
* Develop tools for data extraction for model development and other analysis
* Continuously work on improving methodological choices for the models and be able to clearly communicate its rationale and impact to internal and external stakeholders
* Join an open and inspiring atmosphere, where you will cooperate closely with your colleagues across the bank
* Give input to senior management and business based on data analysis and previous experience



  
 





 You will join a highly professional and dedicated team of quantitative analysts with a large network across the bank and with excellent opportunities for personal and professional development. Joining the team, you’ll have the opportunity to draw and leverage on your teammates’ expertise and commit to excellence. 
 





  

  



 The role is based in Warszawa; Gdańsk; Gdynia; Helsinki; Oslo; Stockholm.
   

  





**Who you are** 


  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share the same values with us.
 





  
 





**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Enjoy learning and are excited about bringing your ideas to the table
* Are dependable, willing to speak up even when it’s difficult
* Have excellent communication skills
* Are committed to empowering others



  
 





**Your experience and background:** 





* Master's or PhD degree in a quantitative field or software development field, including but not limited to mathematics, economics, statistics, data science, software engineering, computer science or similar
* Experience in SQL, Python, SAS or similar
* Experience working with data and models
* Experience in IRB/IFRS9 or CCF modelling is required



  
 





**Nice to have:** 





* Experience in driving deliveries, ideally in an agile environment
* Knowledge of credit risk processes would be an advantage
* Hands on experience in Big Data platforms, e.g. Hadoop
* Understanding of technologies and IT solutions used for data processing



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch! 
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 18/08/2024
 



 .
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

title: Expert IT Architect, Credit Risk/Workflow/Collateral
description:
**Job ID: 22733** 






  
 





 Would you like to grab a challenging and exciting opportunity to shape the future of Nordea’s Credit Risk & Collateral Domain in Group Architecture? We are now looking for an Expert IT Architect to provide architectural support and direction across the enterprise.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.  
 





  
 





**About the role** 






  
 





 The Credit & Collateral Architecture team is expanding and seeking experienced an Expert IT Architect to help define the target architecture vision for the domain and conceptualise the same in transitional steps that can then be delivered through working software across the full SDLC. This manifest itself in the ability to govern, mentor and overseeing the design and implementation work managed through other architecture / engineering resources and developers. You will work as a trusted business advisor and help shaping the strategy, develop technology implementation options, and engineer solutions that achieve the business and technology objectives.
 





  

  



**Primary Responsibilities:** 





* Lead and manage the credit risk domain projects through all phases of the project lifecycle from defining the strategic roadmap with business, developing the technology blueprint, planning the phased IT implementation, setting up the team and the governance structures related to the production rollout /project activities.
* Ability to translate strategic goals through transitional delivery steps, even if that implies justified technical debt to achieve the business outcome.
* Lead Credit Risk and Collateral domain project with blended onshore/offshore teams that range in size from 5 to 25 team members.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders across all business touch points in the domain related to channel integration, pricing, analytics, decisioning, debt collection, scoring and risk modelling.
* In-depth and experienced understanding of operational credit risk functions and capabilities in context of lending products and services in banking and /or insurance.
* Influence the business and technology direction at the divisional or enterprise level based on broad expertise across multiple software platforms and technologies.
* Conduct "Whiteboard", knowledge and requirements gathering sessions with clients through the conceptualisation, design and implementation of new systems, middleware/API, and business intelligence solutions/ reporting solutions.​





 You’ll join a team of experienced architects. The role is based in Helsinki; Gdańsk; Gdynia; Stockholm; Warszawa.
 





  
 





**Who you are** 







*Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage.* 
 These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 




**To succeed in this role, we believe that you have:** 





* Ability to communicate technical concepts in simple terms; must be comfortable presenting solution design concepts and guiding solution design discussions / sessions.
* Ability to work independently, as well as guide and mentor other team members, partners and customers.
* Strong executive presence and ability to interact with senior executives.
* Candidates should be flexible / willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes, but is not limited to only SAFe.





**Qualifications:** 





* 10+ years of related work experience in the areas related to the Credit Risk domain i.e. Collateral Management, Debt Collection, Default Management, Risk Modelling, Regulatory Reporting, Decisioning, Scoring, Rating, Data Governance, Business Intelligence and/or Data Warehousing.
* A minimum of 5+ years’ experience in a client-facing consulting delivery role managing in an onsite / offshore delivery model with emphasis on collaborative working through use of virtual teams.



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 15/08/2024
 



 . For more information about the position please contact Hiring Leader Shabbir Contractor at shabbir.contractor@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Sweden - for union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Poland: Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following: 
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. 
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  
 





 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Account Executive
description:
**About The Opportunity**
**Sales, food, restaurants, relationship building - it's all appetizing huh? Maybe this savory challenge is something for you. We are looking for our next Account Executive who loves to break new sales records while selling ad products & campaigns that create value for our restaurant partners!**
**Your mission**
* Take ownership over hundreds of accounts and being their point of contact
* Sell ad products & Campaigns that creates value for our restaurant partners


 We are looking for a true professional who enjoys working in a dynamic environment and is eager to elevate our team. To thrive in this role, we believe that you are results-oriented and always keep your eyes on the prize. We value individuals who measure success and constantly seek opportunities for improvement, and we hope you do too! If you have a structured approach and a business-minded perspective, combined with high energy and a can-do attitude, you will excel in this role. Since you’ll be collaborating with various stakeholders, your skills in relationship building will be essential to achieving your goals and driving our success.
   

  

 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

**Our recruitment process will include the following:**
 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

**Start date:** 
 Upon agreement
   

  

**What you need to be successful**
* 6 - 12 months experience from working with sales or with the phone as your main tool.
* You communicate fluently verbally and in writing in both Swedish and English. Additional language skills are welcomed!
* If you have a driver's license it’s a big plus!


 Studies have shown that women and some minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are interested in this role and you have most of the skills we’re looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!
   

  

**Who we are**
 ABOUT FOODORA: foodora is a quick commerce and delivery company, present in eight countries in Europe - Austria, Czech, Denmark, Hungary, Finland, Norway, Sweden and Slovakia. With the mission to deliver an amazing, fast and affordable experience, foodora aims to give customers more time to focus on what matters most to them, as well as growing along with their partners, riders and community along the way. foodora is part of Delivery Hero, a pioneer quick commerce company, building the next generation of e-commerce across its operations in over 70 countries across Asia, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa.
   

  

 For more information, please visit www.foodora.com
   

  

 foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide
   

  

**What's in it for you**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Programme Finance Manager in Technology
description:
**Job ID: 25015**




  
 





 Are you passionate about finance and IT, and want to take the next step in your career? We are currently looking for a motivated and dynamic person to join our team of financial managers at Nordea.
 





  
 





 This unique opportunity will give you the responsibility of being the key person in managing the financials of one of Nordea’s largest, and most strategically important Technology programmes. If you have prior knowledge and professional experience from financial IT processes, love communicative teamwork, and see your stakeholder management skills as one of your strongest characteristics, this opportunity would be perfect for you.
   

  





**About this opportunity**




 The Programme Finance Manager will be part of the Technology Planning Analysis team but will be working closely with the Programme Manager and the rest of the Programme leadership team, PMO, Portfolio Partners, Finance Business Partners and Finance Managers to provide financial management and drive financial compliance on a programme level.
 





  

  



**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Support the Sponsor and Programme Manager with financial management support and challenge, including dialogues with senior stakeholders
* Work closely within a cross-functional team to plan, prioritize and develop scope, required resources and budget for initiatives in the programme as member of the Programme leadership team
* Drive the financial management of the line resources required to put the solutions and processes established by the programme into production
* Manage strategic alignment on cross-organizational execution and link to Tech Strategy
* Challenge, validate, quality assure financial forecasting, accruals, and bookings, and be alert to the intangible asset creation resulting from the programme including driving justification for capitalization and economic lifecycle of the assets created
* Ensure and maintain a proactive overview of programme capacity and finances for IT Development and Run (including IT and Business)
* Contribute to a rewarding social climate to promote teamwork and knowledge sharing, and spend time and effort to facilitate good communication and clear financial overview with our stakeholders
* Participate in the establishment and continuous development of common ways of working for programmes within Nordea together with other Programme Finance Managers and controllers





  
 







 The role is based in Gdynia, Helsinki, Copenhagen or Stockholm. We welcome you to a motivated and energetic team with committed and strong relationships cross functionally, with stakeholders all across Nordea.
 





  
 





**Who you are**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the four key values that guide us in being at our best. We imagine that you enjoy learning and are excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You’re dependable, willing to speak up – even when it’s difficult – and committed to empowering others.
 





  
 





 We are looking for someone who can excel in a fast-paced work setting, is goal-oriented, and capable of juggling multiple tasks. You are highly motivated and thrive both as a part of a team or individually, handling diverse tasks while maintaining exceptional quality.
 





  
 





 Your strong communication and presentation skills, along with proficiency in technical tools, are crucial for success in this role.
 





  
 





 In our dynamic and ever-evolving work environment, we value professionals who can handle tight deadlines, have a solutions-focused mindset, and consistently deliver outstanding results.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you have:** 





* Vast professional experience from analyzing and presenting numerical, verbal, and other sources of data and information, and you do this with ease and passion due to your excellent communication skills
* Impressive relationship and network building skills and never hesitate to interact with people outside of your circles
* A natural ability to handle, produce, and nurture multiple projects of various complexities simultaneously, and you take great pride in always being loyal to your deadlines
* Several years of professional experience where you’ve been responsible for complex financial reporting and follow-ups, perhaps as a portfolio manager or similar, preferably in an IT environment
* Full proficiency in verbal and written English



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps** 






  
 






  
 








 We kindly ask you to sumbit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 11/08/2024. The first rounds of interviews will start from week 33 and week 34. Any applications or CVs sent by email, direct messages, or any other channel than our application forms, will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics, and traits make us better at serving our customers and communities.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden -** 
  For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se, or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Poland:** 




 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 







  
 







 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 







  
 







 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at:  
 



 https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 







  
 







 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Löneadministratör
description:
Har du erfarenhet av arbete inom lön och vill du framöver arbeta brett med lön, HR och IT? Vill du vara del av ett innovativt bolag med hållbarhet i fokus? Missa då inte den här möjligheten att bli en del av Volvo On Demand.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Rollen innebär att självständigt ansvara för Volvo On Demands cirka 60 löner, från ax till limpa. Arbetsuppgifterna har en stor variation med allt från lönekörning och kontakt med Försäkringskassan till pensionsrapportering och att vara behjälplig med att besvara medarbetarnas lönefrågor.
   

  

 Vidare innebär rollen att du får möjlighet att arbeta med administrativa uppgifter inom bland annat HR- och IT. Detta innebär bland annat att du kommer vara med och upprätta anställningsavtal, vara involverad i lönerevisionsarbetet och att agera medarbetarnas första kontakt gällande IT-frågor. Du kommer ha många kontaktytor på företaget och rapportera till Head of Accounting.
   

  

 Volvo On Demand erbjuder en varierande roll i ett innovativt företag, du kommer in i ett gott arbetsklimat med positiva och engagerade kollegor. Du kommer ges möjlighet att ta stort ansvar och påverka din arbetssituation.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig med en löneutbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet. Du har sedan tidigare erfarenhet av självständigt lönearbete, exempelvis har du arbetat med en del av lönekedjan och vill nu bredda dig och arbeta med helheten.
   

  

 Du trivs med att supportera dina kollegor i löne-, HR- och IT-frågor och gillar att vara en "go-to person". Att i huvudsak arbeta från kontoret är en självklarhet för dig och du bidrar gärna till en god kontorsmiljö.
   

  

 Du är som person noggrann och säkerställer alltid att arbetsuppgifter färdigställs. Vidare är du framåtlutad, nyfiken och inte rädd för att prova nya saker. Du har en drivkraft att utvecklas och att snabbt sätta dig in i nya arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

**Om Volvo On Demand**
*På Volvo On Demand jobbar vi med mobilitet. Vi gör Volvo-bilar delbara och ger dig som användare enkel tillgång till dem. Hur? Med smart bildelning anpassad efter dina behov.*
*Volvo On Demand är en tjänst som förstår dig och som förenklar din vardag. Behöver du en bil? Kör från en timme till så länge du vill. Boka, hantera, lås upp – allt i en app. Tiden och pengarna du sparar kan du använda till det som verkligen betyder något för dig. Resten tar vi hand om.*
*När vi går från ägande till tillgång förändrar vi dessutom stadsbilden, med mindre trängsel och mer plats för människor. Vi vill utmana gamla tankesätt och sätta nya hållbara idéer i rörelse.*
**Om anställningen**
 Tjänsten är tillsvidare, med en inledande prövotid om 6 månader. Startdatumet är flexibelt och kommer att bestämmas enligt överenskommelse. Placeringen för tjänsten är på huvudkontoret i MOOD-gallerian i centrala Stockholm.
   

  

**Nyfiken på att veta mer?**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Volvo On Demand / Volvo Car Mobility Sweden med Wise Professionals. Du söker enkelt med ditt CV eller din LinkedIn-profil på wise.se och du får då svara på några korta frågor, vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du hjärtligt välkommen att kontakta Karin Steenstrup på karin.steenstrup@wise.se. Vi intervjuar löpande så rollen kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Stort lycka till och välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Har du flera års erfarenhet av cyber- och it-säkerhetsdesign och utveckling inom it-infrastruktur?
description:
Är du redo för ett spännande jobb inom it-säkerhetsarkitektur, lösningar och processer? Kom till oss på Finansinspektionen (FI)! Vi är ett engagerat it-team som arbetar agilt för att leverera tjänster till FI:s medarbetare, allmänheten och företag under vår tillsyn. Nu förstärker vi vår it-organisation.
   

  

 Tillsammans bygger vi lösningar som motverkar hot och på bästa sätt stöttar vårt uppdrag. Inom avdelningen Arkitektur och it-säkerhet finns idag tre definierade ansvarsområden - ledning och styrning, strategi och arkitektur, visualisering och operationell samverkan.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som medarbetare på verksamhetsområde It driver och utvecklar du Finansinspektionens it-säkerhetsarkitektur, lösningar och processer. Du tar fram och utformar it-säkerhetskrav, riktlinjer och arkitekturer. Du är en del av vårt arkitekturteam inom it-säkerhet, som fokuserar på att effektivisera alla olika cyber och it-säkerhetslösningar från ett helhetsperspektiv där alla applikationslösningar och hela it-landskapet ingår från utvecklings- till produktionsmiljöer.
   

  

 Du ser över befintliga lösningar, kravställer förbättringar eller arbetar fram nya lösningar för att höja it-säkerheten i våra it-miljöer. Du driver, leder och följer upp upprätthållande av förmågor och kompetenser gällande it-säkerhet och cyberrisker. Du är nyfiken och brinner för lösningar inom it- och cybersäkerhet och tycker om att skaffa dig nya kunskaper. Du omvärldsbevakar aktivt och följer med utvecklingen inom it och cybersäkerhet.
   

  

 I tidiga utvecklingsfaser samarbetar du med olika kompetenser i agila team för att säkerställa it-säkerheten i kravdokument, lösningsbeskrivningar, riskanalyser kopplat till identifierade behov och krav. Under genomförandet agerar du stöd till våra olika agila team vid behov.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
* har flerårig erfarenhet och gedigen kunskap av design och införande av säkerhetslösningar inom it-infrastruktur och nätverk samt en stark analytisk förmåga att förstå komplexa miljöer och samband
* har flera års erfarenhet av kravställning, design, utredningar, stöd, rådgivning samt granskning av säkerhetslösningar och arkitektur kopplat till infrastrukturarkitektur och lösningar
* har erfarenhet och kunskap av att designa och införa säkerhetslösningar inom .Net, Linux och containerteknik t.ex kubernetics samt hybrida moln miljöer (on-prem integrerad med moln)
* har erfarenhet och kunskap av att designa och införa säkerhetslösningar inom brandväggar, DNS, nätverk, logghantering, SIEM, SOAR, IAM, VDI:er, AD arkitektur, SSO, integration och molnsäkerhet
* har kunskap om hotmodellering, riskbedömningstekniker och ramverk för cybersäkerhet (t.ex. OWASP, NIST)
* har erfarenhet av en logghanteringsplattform (gärna Splunk) samt kunskap av några säkerhetsverktyg som stödjer t.ex SAST, DAST, IAST, RASP och sårbarhetsskannrar
* har akademisk utbildning inom exempelvis systemvetenskap eller civilingenjör
* uttrycker dig väl på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du har
   

  

* certifieringar eller utbildning inom CISSP, CCIE eller CompTIA Security+
* kunskap om MITER ATT&CK-ramverket och cyberkill-chain
* kunskaper i Python och/eller Powershell för skriptning och automatisering
* erfarenhet av att kravställa och genomföra penn-tester
* erfarenhet från en större myndighet eller finansiell sektor i en liknande roll.


**Om dig**
 I det här jobbet behöver du
   

  

* ha en god analytisk förmåga och kunna lösa komplexa uppgifter
* kommunicera tydligt med olika målgrupper
* ta egna initiativ
* se framåt och planera ditt arbete utifrån långsiktiga mål.


**Om FI**
 FI bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, välfungerande marknader, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden.
   

  

 På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans. För mer information om vår organisation: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/organisation/
   

  

 Verksamhetsområde It leder det strategiska digitaliseringsarbetet, driver innovation och ansvarar för internationell koordinering inom it. Vårt uppdrag är brett och vårt ansvarsområde sträcker sig från löpande drift, support och säkerhet till utveckling och förvaltning av våra system, projektledning, arkitektur, upphandlingar samt leverantörsstyrning. Här jobbar cirka 100 personer, fördelade på sex avdelningar och en stab.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Arbetspsykologiska tester ingår i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på FI och vad vi erbjuder: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/lediga-jobb/vi-erbjuder/
   

  

 En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

**Sök jobbet**
 Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv, personligt brev och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis.
   

  

 Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering.
   

  

**Anställningsform:**
 Tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Omfattning:**
 Heltid
   

  

**Kontaktperson:**
 Helena Lejonklou, avdelningschef, 08-408 986 23
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:**
 2024-08-09

title: Avdelningschef till Vattenfall Services
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

**Vill du bli en viktig del av energiomställningen? Vattenfall Services är Sveriges ledande entreprenadbolag inom energi- och elkraftsområdet och vi utvecklar Sveriges energiinfrastruktur! Hos oss jobbar du i en framtidsbransch med stort fokus på en hållbar framtid. Vi behöver fler energihjältar och nu söker vi en Avdelningschef som vill vara med på resan mot ett fossilfritt liv! Är det du? Tillsammans gör vi skillnad, för hela samhället.**
 I rollen som avdelningschef kommer du ansvara för en avdelning som består av ca 20 stycken medarbetare. Avdelningen bestående av tekniker, beredare och projektledare. Personalen är placerad i Jordbro men verkar över en större geografi i närområdet. Utöver den egna avdelningen så ingår du även i ledningsgruppen för affärsområdet Ledningar Stockholm. Tillsammans jobbar vi för att bidra till hela affärsområdets fortsatta tillväxt och utveckling.
   

  

**Som Avdelningschef** 
 har du ett övergripande ansvar över avdelningens del inom ett av affärsområdets stora serviceavtal av ett elnät. I ansvaret ingår avtalskännedom och därmed ett leverans- och resultatansvar. Du kommer sitta med elnätsägaren och föra dialoger kopplat till den operativa verksamheten. Avdelningen jobbar främst med felavhjälpning, underhåll och projekt. Du är ett dagligt stöd till dina medarbetare i både personalfrågor men även i den dagliga verksamheten rörande tekniska samt operativa frågor.
   

  

 Som avdelningschef arbetar du även med utveckling av avdelningens medarbetare och verksamhet i en affärsmässig miljö där säkerhet har högsta prioritet. Arbetet är omväxlande och du förväntas ha nära kontakt med kunder, kollegor och medarbetare.
   

  

***Exempel på ansvar och arbetsuppgifter***
* Personal- och resursplanering, hålla dig och avdelningen uppdaterad om tjänster och säkra arbetssätt samt arbeta för vidareutveckling och uppföljning av metoder och vår leverans
* Vara ett daglig stöd i tekniska och operativa frågor gentemot personalen
* Ansvara över prognos, budget, resultat- och verksamhetsuppföljning samt analys av verksamheten med stöttning av en projekt controller
* Kundkontakter och utveckling av befintliga och nya affärer
* Vara delaktig i upphandlingar, anbuds- och avtalshantering
* Aktivt delta i ledningsgruppen och utveckla samt möjliggör ett gott samarbete inom affärsområdet Ledningar Stockholm


 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som bidrar med lyhördhet, öppenhet och ett starkt fokus på arbetsmiljö och säkerhet. Du är en engagerad ledare som har förmågan att ena samt motivera dina medarbetare. Du ser till gruppens bästa samtidigt som du har en affärsmässig drivkraft. Du är engagerad i den dagliga verksamheten och vill finnas som stöd för dina medarbetare i tekniska och operativa frågor. Du är en initiativtagande och kommunikativ person som har en stark egen motivation till att stödja utvecklingen av verksamheten, människorna inom den och våra affärer.
   

  

***Vi vet att du kommer utvecklas tillsammans med oss men vi ser gärna att du redan har:***
* Lägst en avklarad gymnasial utbildning, gärna högre studier och inom ett relevant område
* Flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta som ledare, gärna i en roll med personalansvar
* Flera års erfarenhet av elkraft, kraftförsörjning och kraftsystem
* Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av kund- och leverantörsrelationer, ekonomisk uppföljning och avtalshantering
* Erfarenhet av entreprenadbranschen är meriterande
* Du har god IT- och systemvana. Vi arbetar även i en processdriven verksamhet
* Du talar och skriver både svenska och engelska obehindrat
* B-körkort


 Mer information
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
*Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.*
**Placeringsort**
 Jordbro
   

  

**För mer information** 
 om själva tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Jari Rosenblad jari.rosenblad@vattenfall.com
   

  

 För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Berivan Bozan berivan.bozan@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Fackliga representanter är Alma Svensson Unionen, Johan Larsson (Hallsberg) SEKO, Torbjörn Blom Akademikerna och Magnus Tjergefors Ledarna. Samtliga nås via Vattenfalls växel 08-739 50 00.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 4 augusti 2024.** 
 Urval och intervjuer sker efter sista ansökningsdatum. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats.
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.
   

  

 Då säkerheten för Vattenfall och dess anställda är avgörande kommer vi innan varje anställning genomföra en ”pre-employment screening”. Dessa kontroller baseras på din roll som du kommer att fylla inom Vattenfall.
   

  

 Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid. Vi vill nu göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt inom en generation och vi driver på övergången till ett hållbart energisystem.

title: Premium Account Executive
description:
**Job Title**
 Premium Account Executive
   

  

**Job Description**
**Premium Account Executive**
 Join us as a Premium Account Executive to drive new business growth, enhance client retention, and reactivate premium clients. We seek a dynamic professional who excels in forging new relationships, developing strategic sales initiatives, and ensuring continued satisfaction and loyalty among our top-tier clients. Join us as a Premium Account Executive to drive new business growth, enhance client retention, and reactivate premium clients. We seek a dynamic professional who excels in forging new relationships, developing strategic sales initiatives, and ensuring continued satisfaction and loyalty among our top-tier clients.
   

  

**So, who are we?**
 Hello, we’re IG Group. No, not Instagram – though we're a pretty big deal ourselves. We’re a global, FTSE 250-listed company made up of a collection of progressive fintech brands in the world of online trading and investing. The best part? We’ve snapped up many awards for our top-class platforms, forward-thinking products, and incredible employee experiences. We believe in financial freedom. And our purpose is to help ambitious people achieve it. Around 400,000 people use our groundbreaking technology and forward-thinking platforms to trade the financial products they know and love.
   

  

 Did we mention we have offices in 18 countries?
   

  

 Yes, when you join IG Group, you'll have the chance to work across multiple brands, with people all over the world. Join us for an exciting future and let’s innovate together!
   

  

**Your role in the team**
 As a key member of our team, you will collaborate closely with marketing, product development, and trading services to create tailored solutions that meet our clients' needs. Your strategic insights and proactive approach will be instrumental in achieving our ambitious growth targets and maintaining our reputation for excellence.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Client Retention and Satisfaction: Build strong relationships with existing clients, ensuring high satisfaction and retention rates.
* Reactivation of Inactive Accounts: Proactively reach out to lapsed clients to rekindle relationships and renew their engagement with our services.
* Collaborate Cross-Functional: Work closely with marketing, product development, and customer support to develop tailored solutions and enhance the customer experience.
* Develop and Execute Sales Strategies: Identify and target new business opportunities to drive revenue growth within premium accounts.
* Market and Competitor Analysis: Stay informed about industry trends and competitor activities to inform strategic planning and decision-making.
* Achieve Sales Targets: Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets, contributing significantly to the company’s overall growth objectives.


**Who we’re looking for?**
 You’re curious about things like the client experience, the rapid developments in tech, and the complex world of fintech regulation. You’re also a confident, creative thinker with a knack for innovating. We know that you know every problem has a solution. Here, you can try new ideas, and lead the way in creating inspiring experiences for our clients and everyone around you.
   

  

 We don’t fit the corporate stereotype. If you want to work for a traditional, suit-and-tie corporate that just gives you a pay cheque at the end of the month, we might not be for you. But, if you have that IG Group energy and you can stand behind what we believe in, let’s raise the bar together.
   

  

**What you’ll need for this role:**
* About 1 year trading services / customer services or client management experience
* Fluency in English and Swedish language
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills (the key is to be able to empathize with our clients)
* Analytical and logical approach to problem solving
* Strong time management and organisational skills
* Motivated to succeed by achieving and surpassing individual and team KPIs
* Passionate about financial markets, financial products and client services.
* Selling and commercial skills


**How you’ll grow:**
 When you join IG Group, we want you to have more than a job – we want you to have a career. And you can. If you spot an opportunity, we want you to chase it. Stretch yourself, challenge your self-beliefs and go for the things you dream of. With internal and external learning opportunities, and the tools to help you skyrocket to success, we’ll support you all the way. And these opportunities truly are endless because we have some bold targets. We plan to expand our global presence, increase revenue growth, and ultimately deliver the world’s best trading experience. We’d love to have you along for the ride
   

  

**The perks:**
 It really is more than a job. We’ll recognize your talent and make sure that you can still have a life – at work, and outside of it. Networks, committees, awards, sports and social clubs, mentorship, volunteering opportunities, extra time off… the list goes on.
   

  

**Where you’ll work**
 We follow a hybrid working model; we reckon it’s the best of both worlds. This model also feeds into our secret ingredients for innovation: diversity, flexibility, and close connection. Plus, you’ll be welcomed into a diverse and inclusive workforce with a lot of creative energy. Ask our employees what their favorite thing is about working at IG, and you’ll hear an echo of ‘our culture’! That’s because you can come to work as your authentic self. The things that make you, you – like your ethnicity, sexual orientation, faith, age, gender identity/expression or physical capacity – can bring a fresh perspective or new skill to our business. That’s why we welcome people from various walks of life; and anyone who wants to help us realise our vision and strategy. So, if you’re keen to connect with our values, and lead the charge on innovation, you know what to do-
 **Apply now!**
**Number of openings**
 1

title: Public Sector Sales Executive
description:
Hungry, Humble, Honest, with Heart.
   

  

 The Opportunity
   

  

 Nutanix is looking for a a
 **Public Sector Sales Executive,** 
 you will be a highly visible, key player within the Nutanix field sales team, tasked to drive net new business in large Government Agencies, Healthcare Regions, Universities and top Government Owned Companies.
   

  

 You are responsible for selling Nutanix’s Products and Solutions directly to large Public customers and prospects. You will also be working closely with Presales Engineers and the extended account team.
   

  

**About The Team**
 At Nutanix, you will be joining the Swedish team. This team is known for its exceptional performance and in combination with a consistent class leading employee-NPS score. The team strongly value collaboration across functions and hierarchies, making it a fun, dynamic and rewarding environment to be a part of. As part of your role, you will be expected to travel within Sweden to visit prospective and existing customers. This travel requirement provides you with the opportunity to engage directly with clients and build strong relationships, further enhancing the impact and reach of your work within the region.
   

  

 Your Role
   

  

* As a Public Sector Sales Executive, you will be a highly visible, key player within the Nutanix field sales team, tasked to drive net new business in large Government Agencies, Healthcare Regions, Universities and top Government Owned Companies.
* You will work in close partnership with an experienced technical Pre-sales engineer
* Forge new and cultivate existing Partner relationships (Resellers, Global Systems Integrators and Alliances) to align go-to-market strategies at the account level.
* Work collaboratively across Nutanix cross-functional teams such as Channel Sales, Marketing, Sales Operations, Product Management to ensure the best possible coverage for your accounts.
* Drive accurate and timely sales forecasting through SFDC
* Develop account plans for Tier 1 Accounts
* Build and strengthen the business relationship with current accounts and new prospects by promoting Nutanix’s impact across other Public Sector organisations.
* Recommend Public Sector marketing strategies


 What You Will Bring
   

  

* >7 year of outside software sales experience
* A track record of exceeding sales quotas in multiple, continuous years.
* Keen ability to develop new accounts and penetrate new divisions and organizations within your assigned accounts.
* Expertise in selling technology solutions to the Swedish Public Sector, having an existing network of relevant customer stakeholders within this sector which you will utilize.
* An aptitude to articulate how Nutanix technology solve business problems, acting as a trusted advisor to the most demanding public sector organisations in Sweden
* Deep understanding of the competitive landscape and how Nutanix differentiates
* Deep understanding of the customers and partner ecosystem in the region
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills for large audiences
* An entrepreneurial spirit with an affinity for growth, collaboration, and teamwork.
* Highly organized, with deep knowledge of account planning and strategy.
* An expert in Target Account Selling and consultative solution selling
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

title: UCPM Expert for multi-year resilience project in Ukraine
description:
**Introduction**
 The Swedish Civil Contingencies Agency (MSB) recruits committed and skilled experts for our humanitarian, resilience and peace support operations worldwide on a daily basis. We have great experience on working together and strengthening other organisations, for example other civil protection agencies to prevent and prepare for crisis, conflicts or other disasters. MSB has actively supported Ukrainian and multilateral partners with expertise, capacity development and materials already before Russia’s full-scale invasion of the country. MSB is now planning for a multi-year capacity development partnership in line with Swedish priorities aiming to increase Ukraine’s resilience and capability to reduce and manage consequences of emergencies and war.
   

  

 MSB is looking for an UCPM Expert for one of the project components focusing on developing a long- term partnership with the State Emergency Service of Ukraine (SESU), acting as the main civil protection agency in Ukraine. One initially identified area for collaboration with SESU lie within support to developing both organizational aspects and operational capabilities within the framework of an integration into the UCPM. Ukraine became a participating state within the UCPM in April 2023 and is now working towards becoming a full member as a part of the EU accession process. Since the start of the war, SESU has communicated with the UCPM regarding requesting and receiving international support. Through the MSB led programme PPRD East 3 and other initiatives SESU has strengthened the organisational knowledge on UCPM through trainings.
   

  

 Preliminary start in aug/sept 2024.
   

  

**Introduction swedish**
 Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap (MSB) rekryterar dagligen engagerade och kompetenta experter till våra nationella, internationella, humanitära och resiliens- och fredsfrämjande insatser. Vi har stor erfarenhet av att arbeta tillsammans och stärka andra organisationer som t.ex. andra civilskyddsmyndigheter vid kriser, konflikter eller andra katastrofer. MSB har aktivt stöttat ukrainska och andra parter med expertis, kapacitetsutveckling och material redan före Rysslands fullskaliga invasion av landet. MSB planerar nu för ett flerårigt samarbete för kapacitetsutveckling i linje med svenska prioriteringar som syftar till att öka Ukrainas motståndskraft och förmåga att minska och hantera konsekvenserna av kriser och krig.
   

  

 MSB söker nu en UCPM-expert till en del av projektet med fokus på att utveckla ett långsiktigt partnerskap med Ukrainas räddningstjänst (SESU), som hanterar merparten av räddningstjänsten i Ukraina. Ett initialt identifierat område för samverkan med SESU ligger inom stöd för att utveckla såväl organisatoriska aspekter som operativa förmågor inom ramen för en integration i UCPM. Ukraina blev en deltagande stat inom UCPM i april 2023 och arbetar nu för att bli en fullvärdig medlem som en del av EU-anslutningsprocessen. Sedan krigets början har SESU kommunicerat med UCPM angående att begära och ta emot internationellt stöd. Genom det MSB-ledda programmet PPRD East 3 och andra initiativ har SESU stärkt den organisatoriska kunskapen om UCPM genom utbildning och övning.
   

  

 Preliminär start i aug/sept 2024.
   

  

**Duties**
 The UCMP Expert plays a key role for the strengthening of SESU capacities focusing on processual, organisational and operational aspects of utilizing and working within UCPM. Expected work assignments are:
   

  

* Facilitate orientation of UCPM tools and processes and sharing of Swedish experience of utilizing them
* Contribute to an analysis of SESU’s current and desired capabilities in relation to UCPM.
* Support the development of different capacities needed to make use of UCPM tools, through activities such as training, mentorship, exchanges
* Plan and design learning and exchange activities
* Support Ukraine’s participation within the UCPM framework
* Contribute to the development of the project’s activity plan and results framework
* Coordinate with partner organisation and MSB project’s staff
* Consolidate documentation and reporting from project activities
* Contribute to identifying and communicating relevant learnings from the Ukraine experience back to MSB.
* Other work assignments might be discussed as/if required.


**Qualifications**
**Experience**
* At least 5 years relevant professional experience, in the field of Disaster Risk Management and Crisis Response or similar fields, of which a minimum of 3 years are relevant operational experience at strategic level with responsibility of project implementation and results fulfilment, including planning and coordination
* Good understanding of the EU and the UCPM
* Demonstrated experience of working with UCPM tools and processes
* Experience of planning and facilitating learning activities


 Merits:
   

  

* Experience of implementation/coordination of capacity development programmes or similar
* Understanding of integrating of cross-cutting issues, such as gender equality, human rights and environmental perspectives into programme implementation
* Good understanding of the Swedish experience of UCPM membership
* Working experience in Ukraine or the nearby region


**Education**
